onix.collection.battle.ConditionChange_¶

alias of ConditionChange

class onix.collection.battle.Effect[source]¶

Bases: object

A change in the conditions of the battle. Could be damage infliction, could be a condition change (volatile, like confusion, or non-volatile, like burn or faint), or could be a change to the field (e.g. weather). Could be caused by a move, an item, an ability or a field effect (e.g. entry hazards)

apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the effect to a battle state

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:

ValueError – if the effect is inconsistent with the current battle state
class onix.collection.battle.Event[source]¶

Bases: object

Something that happened in a battle, e.g., a move or an ability being triggered

get_cause()[source]¶

Get the cause of the event (e.g. the move or the field effect)

Returns:the cause of the event
Return type:object
get_effects()[source]¶

Get the effects of the event (e.g. the damage dealt)

Returns:the effects of the event
Return type:iterable of Effect
class onix.collection.battle.FieldChange[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.FieldChange, onix.collection.battle.Effect

A change in a field conditions (e.g. weather)

Parameters:
  • side (1, 2 or None) – the side affected (None corresponds to both sides)
  • field_condition (str) – the field condition
  • ending (bool) – False if the field condition is starting, True if the field effect is ending

Note

Stacking entry hazards should be handled as the previous level ending and the next level beginning, e.g., laying down a second layer of spikes would be represented by [FieldChange(1, 'spikes_1', True), FieldChange(1, 'spikes_2', False)]

apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the field condition change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:

ValueError – if you’re trying to end a field condition that’s not currently active or start one that’s already active

A non-move event (for now, the only event-type where we want additional structure is moves)

Parameters:

  • effects (iterable of Effect) – the effects of the event

class onix.collection.battle.HPctChange[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.HPctChange, onix.collection.battle.Effect

A change in hit points, represented as percent health (exact, not rounded)

Parameters:
  • slot (Slot) – the slot of the affected Pokemon
  • old_pct (float) – 100 * pre-event hit points / max hit points
  • new_pct (float) – 100 * post-event hit points / max hit points
apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the HP change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:

ValueError – if the old HP of the specified Pokemon isn’t what is expected by the effect.

onix.collection.battle.Matchup_¶

alias of Matchup

class onix.collection.battle.Move(move, user, targets, effects, failure_reason=None)[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.Event

A move used by a Pokemon in a battle

Parameters:
  • move (str) – the name of the move
  • user (Slot) – the slot of the Pokemon who used the move
  • targets (iterable of Slot) – the slots of the Pokemon targeted by the move
  • effects (iterable of Effect) – the effects of the move
  • failure_reason (str, optional) – if the move failed, specify the reason why. If no reason is given, the move will be considered to have succeeded. Defaults to None (that is, to the move being successful)
move¶

str – the name of the move

user¶

Slot – the slot of the Pokemon who used the move

targets¶

list of Slot – the slots of the Pokemon targeted by the move

effects¶

list of Effect – the effects of the move

success¶

bool – did the move succeed?

failure_reason¶

str – the reason why the move failed (if the move succeeded, then this will be None)

get_cause()[source]¶

Get the cause of the event, in this case, the move user and the move name

Returns:
  • Slot : the slot of the move user
  • str : the name of the used move
Return type:(tuple)
get_effects()[source]¶

Get the effects of the move (e.g. the damage dealt and any secondary effects)

Returns:the effects of the event
Return type:iterable of Effect
class onix.collection.battle.MovesetChange[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.MovesetChange, onix.collection.battle.Effect

A change in an attribute of a Pokemon that’s considered part of its Moveset (e.g. item, ability, stats...). This includes mega evolution and other forme changes.

Note

The way to handle volatile changes (e.g. ability suppression or stat changes due to, say, Power Swap) is to revert the change on switch-out.

Parameters:
  • slot (Slot) – the slot of the affected Pokemon
  • old_moveset (Moveset) – the pre-event moveset
  • new_moveset (Moveset) – the post-event moveset
apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the non-volatile condition change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:

ValueError – if the old moveset of the specified Pokemon isn’t what is expected by the effect.
onix.collection.battle.MovesetChange_¶

alias of MovesetChange

class onix.collection.battle.NonVolatileConditionChange[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.ConditionChange, onix.collection.battle.Effect

A change in non-volatile (e.g. burn or faint).

Parameters:
  • slot (Slot) – the slot of the affected Pokemon
  • condition (str) – the condition
  • recovery (bool) – False if this is a new condition (the Pokemon was previously unafflicted), True if the Pokemon is recovering from this condition
apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the non-volatile condition change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:
  • ValueError – if self.condition is “faint” and self.recovery is True (there’s no reviving)
  • ValueError – if you’re trying to cure the Pokemon of a condition it doesn’t have or inflict it with a condition (besides faint) when it already has a condition
class onix.collection.battle.Slot[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.Slot

A reliable way to reference a Pokemon in a battle.

Parameters:
  • side (1 or 2) – the player number
  • index (int) – the index of the Pokemon on the player’s team
onix.collection.battle.Slot_¶

class onix.collection.battle.StageChange[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.battle.StageChange, onix.collection.battle.Effect

A change in a stat’s stage (e.g. -1 Atk due to Intimidate)

Parameters:
  • slot (Slot) – the slot of the affected Pokemon
  • stat (str) – the affected stat
  • old_stage (int) – the pre-event stage (0 is normal)
  • new_stage (int) – the post-event stage (0 is normal)
apply_effect(battle_state, inplace=True)[source]¶

Apply the stage change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:
  • ValueError – if self.stat is “hp” (there are no HP stages)
  • ValueError – if the old stage of the specified Pokemon isn’t what is specified by the effect.

Parameters:
  • slot (Slot) – the slot of the affected Pokemon
  • condition (str) – the condition
  • recovery (bool) – False if this is a new condition (the Pokemon was previously unafflicted), True if the Pokemon is recovering from this condition

Apply the volatile condition change

Parameters:
  • battle_state (BattleState) – the battle state to which to apply the effect
  • inplace (bool, optional) – if False, makes a copy of the battle state before applying the effect, if True, operate in-place. Default is True.
Returns:

the updated battle state
Return type:

BattleState
Raises:

ValueError – if you’re trying to cure the Pokemon of a condition it doesn’t have or inflict it with a condition it already has

onix.collection.log_reader module¶

Functionality for taking PS logs & structuring them into a desired format

class onix.collection.log_reader.JsonFileLogReader(sanitizer=None, pokedex=None, items=None)[source]¶

Bases: onix.collection.log_reader.LogReader

Parses Pokemon Showdown .json files

Parameters:
  • sanitizer (Sanitizer, optional) –
    used to normalize the data read in from the log. If none is
    specified, will create its own
  • pokedex (dict, optional) – data including base stats, species abilities and forme info. If none is specified will attempt to load from file, and if the file doesn’t exist will scrape the data from the Pokemon Showdown GitHub
  • items (dict, optional) – used for determining mega stones. If none is specified will attempt to load from file, and if the file doesn’t exist will scrape it from the Pokemon Showdown GitHub
parse_log(log)[source]¶

Parse the provided log and return structured data

Parameters:

log (str) – file name of the battle log to parse
Returns:

  • BattleInfo : metadata about the match

  • tuple of tuple of Moveset
    : the movesets

    used in the battle, grouped by team

  • Battle : a structured turn-by-turn recounting of the battle
Return type:

(tuple)
Raises:
  • ParsingException – if there’s a problem parsing the log
  • FileNotFoundError – if the log doesn’t exist
  • json.decoder.JSONDecodeError – if the log is not a valid log
class onix.collection.log_reader.LogReader[source]¶

Bases: object

An object which takes in a Pokemon Showdown log (in whatever format it exists) and returned structured data, ready for compiling or storing

parse_log(log)[source]¶

Parse the provided log and return structured data

Parameters:log – the log to parse, in whatever format the reader can parse
Returns:
  • BattleInfo : metadata about the match
  • tuple of tuple of Moveset
    : the movesets
    used in the battle, grouped by team
  • Battle : a structured turn-by-turn recounting of the battle
Return type:(tuple)
Raises:ParsingException – if there’s a problem parsing the log
